content:
Opening this thread as suggested by Alya Abbott in #25014.

Read #feedback > time machine for All messages for context.

Two things I'd like to discuss here,

  1. Do we want to have a heading on top of the flatpickr dialog that says something like Jump to date. Personally, I find it distracting.
  2. What do we want the text on the Scroll to top button? I've chosen that for now because the tippy on the Scroll to bottom button says, well that.

image.png

Third, does it look better to have the or and Scroll to top in center or the previous version is better?
image.png
This topic was moved here from #issues > jump to date flatpickr by Alya Abbott.
Center-aligned looks better to me, on the "scroll to top," though I think I'd put "or [Scroll to top]" on the same line as each other.
It also looks like the popup has square corners in the top, which are poking out over the rounded border.

Alex Vandiver said:

It also looks like the popup has square corners in the top, which are poking out over the rounded border.

Didn't notice that, thanks!
I think I'd need to try it in order to have a strong opinion on these questions; ideally it'd be easy to change our mind on these things in the code anyway?
Yep, I'll be waiting for your feedback when you try it.

@Lakshay Mittal currently when I try it and select a date when no message has been sent, focus goes to the message sent around the selected date. I think we should rethink about this behaviour - possibly should show a warning/error that no messages found on the selected date?
Hmm, I'm not sure it's worth popping up a warning/error if we're just taking you to the messages closest to a date because there's nothing on that date.

Yeah, if I'm jumping to a date, I don't care if there's anything actually precisely there -- I'll be able to see there wasn't anything specifically there, and it's just as useful to see the things around where it would be.
@Lakshay Mittal left a review: https://github.com/zulip/zulip/pull/25014#pullrequestreview-1423832022
I'll try to address your feedback when a window opens up. I am busy in something else right now!
